benchmark_details.name: HLS-Eval
benchmark_details.overview: HLS-Eval is the first comprehensive benchmark and evaluation framework for LLM-driven high-level synthesis (HLS) design tasks, focusing on generating HLS code from natural language descriptions and making HLS-specific code edits to existing HLS code.
benchmark_details.data_type: HLS design cases with natural language descriptions and testbenches

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive and modular benchmarking suite for evaluating LLMs in the context of HLS design tasks.

data.source: Community HLS benchmarks, academic textbooks, and open-source hardware accelerators
data.annotation: Manually reviewed and structured from existing HLS designs

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on pass rates for generated HLS outcomes.
methodology.interpretation: Higher pass rates indicate better performance and compatibility of the LLM-generated HLS code.
methodology.baseline_results: Evaluated results for multiple open-source LLMs, indicating pass rates for different metrics.
methodology.validation: Evaluations conducted using AMD/Xilinx Vitis HLS 2024.1.
